title: Manchester City ready to hand Raheem Sterling new deal less than 12 months after last renewal
text:
Raheem Sterling signed a new deal in November 2018 (Picture: Getty)

Manchester City are keen on handing Raheem Sterling a new contract less than 12 months after his previous renewal, Metro.co.uk can reveal.

The England international was made one of the best paid players in the division when he signed a three-year extension worth around £300,000-a-week in November 2018.

Sterling had just over 18 months to run on his deal at the time and City feared losing the forward on a cut-price deal that summer as he entered the last year of his contract.

The 24-year-old has admitted since signing his new deal that he plans on fulfilling his ‘dream’ of playing abroad during his career and City want to protect their £50m investment in the former Liverpool star.

Sterling has admitted an ambition to playing in Spain (Picture: Getty)

Sources have told Metro.co.uk that City value Sterling at around £200m and the club want to avoid a repeat of last time where his camp allowed his deal to run into its final 18 months.

City accept that Sterling is likely to seek a move to Spain at some point during his career but they want him to spend his peak at the Etihad, particularly as Sergio Aguero’s time at the club comes to an end.

Raheem Sterling on ambitions to play abroad, July 2019 ‘Looking at it now it’s like, Manchester, I love it. I love it here. This is one of the best clubs in the world and I’m here for the long haul. But you just don’t know what happens in the future. I’m still young and, like I say, I am loving every minute. Ever since I was a kid, 100 per cent it’s always been a dream of mine to play abroad somewhere. It would be nice one day to finish training and go home and sit in your garden and eat some dinner. I would need to see where it’s minimum 17C or 18C constantly.’

There is also a sense of forward planning on City’s part. Ten of Sterling’s 12 England goals have come in the last year and his profile is likely to skyrocket if England make it into the final stages of the European Championships this summer.

City hope to sit down with the forward’s representatives in the New Year to discuss an extension that would reflect the progression Sterling has made since his last renewal.

The club feel it is imperative to reward the squad for their performances and they handed new deals to the likes of Aymeric Laporte and Ederson just 12 months into their stints at the Etihad.
